node.title: Six-year-old and siblings join pocket money to buy house
node.description: "The price on that block has already gone up [by] $70,000."
node.content: ["A house and land package in Australia's Victoria has been bought by a six-year-old and her siblings for nearly AU$700,000 (NZ$742,000).\n", "The section is in the southeast Melbourne suburb of Clyde.", "Six-year-old Ruby and her two siblings bought the property by joining their pocket money together, 7 News reported.", "Along with the help of their father, the children contributed $2000 each of their pocket money towards the deposit.", "The house could double in value over the next decade, their property investment expert dad Cam McClellan believes.\u00a0", "\"The price on that block has already gone up [by] $70,000 (NZ$74,000), so they've done well so far,\" McClellan told 7 News.\u00a0\n", "It comes as many first home buyers in Australia, like New Zealand, are struggling to get on to the market amid booming prices.", "New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern earlier this month said runaway property prices couldn't continue and wanted to see them drop.\u00a0"]
